interface.name: zwf_window_manager_v1
interface.description:
The purpose of this protocol is to enable the creation of taskbars and docks by providing them with a list of opened applications and letting them request certain actions on them, like maximizing, etc.
Each created window has a list of outputs it is visible on.

interface.name: zwf_window_v1
interface.description: A zwf_window_v1 object represents an opened window. Each app may have multiple opened windows.

event.name: title
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the title of the window changes and immediately after the creation of the zwf_window_v1

event.name: app_id
event.description: This event is emitted whenever the app-id of the window changes or after it is created (the initial title)

event.name: enter_output
event.description:
This event is emitted whenever the window becomes visible on the given output. A window may be visible on multiple outputs.
The output is identified by its name, which is identical to the name in xdg-output

event.name: leave_output
event.description:
This event is emitted whenever the window stops being visible on the given output. It is guaranteed that an entered-output event with the same output has been emitted before this event.
The output is identified by its name, which is identical to the name in xdg-output

request.name: focus
request.description: Request that the current window is focused. However, there is no guarantee the window will be actually focused.

request.name: minimize
request.description: Request that the window is minimized. No guarantee the window will actually be minimized.

event.name: destroyed
event.description: This event means the window has been destroyed. It is guaranteed there won't be any more events for this zwf_window_v1. The client must not send any requests after this either.
